name: Mandarin Orchard Singapore

reviews.text: In my opinion the price was too high for this kind of hotel/room. The water pressure of the shower was pretty low (23th floor), the room was ok, to access the hotel you've to go through a side entrance - cause of building works (till Oct 2009!). Additional you've to switch the elevator to access your floor.
reviews.title: "Ok" but under my expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 7 night stay. The Hotel is in a great location on Orchard Road. Even though the Hotel is under going renovations, we were not disturbed by noise at all during our stay. The staff are all very accommodating, nothing to much trouble, our room was very clean & spacious.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: Booked our 5 night stay with great anxiety after reading about renovations and noise, etc. Thankfully was completely floored by the hotel. Renovations are on in the tower which is on the main road and we were completely unaffected with our room in the side tower. The room and bathroom looks brand new and is a luxurious size with all the comforts you can think of. The highlight was that you could shop away at all the malls on Orchard and come back to drop off your bags 10 times a day if you wanted to! We got a room for about $140USD without breakfast but inclusive of taxes, etc. Was totally worth the money and could travel around with great ease to Clarke Quay, etc by taxi, although the MRT is a few minutes walk away we didn't bother with it.
reviews.title: Fabulous, flawless!

reviews.text: I cannot begin to describe what a pleasant experience it has been staying at the Meritus Mandarin. From the moment I was attended to at the Front Desk during check-in to the moment I stepped out of the premises after check-out, I felt I was completely in good hands. There are a few people I wish particularly to thank:
reviews.title: They sure deliver their promise of Asian grace, warmth and care.

reviews.text: - Isabel Tan and Michelle Sam(?) from Front Desk; they were extremely quick and efficient and, despite the mob queuing up in the lobby, made checking in a painless process.
reviews.title: Too Much Hype!!

reviews.text: Singapore is a shopping place for me. To have a hotel right in the middle of the shopping district is really great. We can drop off our shopping bags before we head on to next places. There are enough choices of food around the area.
reviews.title: Would be back to this hotel.

reviews.text: The location of Mandarin Orchard is perfect, the rate of the hotel room is pricey but not unreasonable.
reviews.title: Best Location in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I happily recommended this hotel to my sister in law and they are all happy with the hotel too.
reviews.title: Home away from home
Better than some but can't handle the crowds
reviews.text: This is my top choice hotel for Singapore so far.

For this trip , my husband and I stayed for 2 nights on business and leisure. The hotel has been renovated. We had a twin-bed room and i think the twin beds were so small . The location is perfect for dining and shopping. A lot of events in Ngee Ann Shopping and Takashimaya Dept. Thanks to the Hotel that gave me vouchers of shopping discounts as compliments. Breakfast has variety of Asian foods but the taste is so so.
reviews.title: Corafay

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights on business. The room was very comfortable and large. The bathroom was very nice. The service was good. The room was clean. The attendants at the desk were polite and helpful. There is a lot of shopping available in the bottom stories of the hotel. I didn't partake, but it looked nice.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel over a short 2-day business trip in February 2013. Unfortunately, the hotel was almost full and as we landed in the morning the rooms were not ready. They made us wait a good 2 hours but gave complementary breakfast to apologise. The staff, however, was rude and did not accept its mistake of not having the rooms ready.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Super crowded. Amazing location. Good food options.

reviews.text: The hotel has a nice location. Right on the Orchard street that is peppered with food joints and retail shops. The metro station is 10 mins walk from the hotel. The restaurants serve very good food. The breakfast buffet spread is great and there is a lot of choice.
reviews.title: Super Busy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you plan to hire a cab for a planned meeting or departing to the airport, please keep additional buffer, the queue for cabs at the hotel basement is too long for anybody's comfort.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: Perfect Location in the heart of Orchard Road. if you visit this town for shopping purpose stay in this hotel is always right, surroundings by all the fine shopping center for sure 1 week is short.
reviews.title: Wonderfull location

reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms and stayed 3 nights at Mandarin Orchard with my family groups. The hotel centrally located on the heart of Orchard road.
reviews.title: Good Location but dissatisfied with the services

reviews.text: I went to the hotel for checked-in around 4 p.m. but I got the keys for only one room and They were told to come back for the other room with unspecified length of time. At 5.30 p.m. we went to ask at the lobby if the other room is ready. The staff said the second room still was not ready and could not tell when it will be ready. It depended on housekeeping they said. I'm very dissatisfied for this.... and There is no place to sit at the lobby for guests to wait, only 2 sofas for 6 people in the lobby. We had to go out and came back around 7 p.m., the room was then ready.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: We got the room on the Main tower, The room was not clean enough especially the carpet in the room look so dirty. Our kid lost a toy under the bed so we had to look under the bed for the toy. Oh my!! The carpet under the bed has probably never been cleaned! Extremely dirty there.
reviews.title: Very poor housekeeping

reviews.text: When we checked out, we waited for the bellman to come pick up luggage forever! We called them twice. We waited until we could not wait any longer and decided to bring the luggage down ourselves.
reviews.title: Strategic Location in Singapore

reviews.text: So, besides the very good location, don't expect much from anything else.
reviews.title: Strategic location but poor room housekeeping

reviews.text: During this trip with my wife and 8 year old son we decided to book a hotel in Orchard Road and we enjoyed every bit of our stay. Though the hotel is under renovation the management sees to it that you won't be bothered by this. Though the temporary location of its reception is small and if you plan on waiting in the lobby you can't find a spot to seat. Check-in was a breeze even though we arrived earlier than the required check-in time. Small items added to the over-all experience, like complimentary fruits by the bed side in the afternoon. Location also plays a great role, everything is within a few minutes walk, shops, restaurants, subway station, etc.. Will definitely stay here again next time.
reviews.title: Great Location, wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Meritus Mandarin for a week this past February. It was an excellent hotel, right on Orchard Road. A classy venue at a good price... Thank you, you will not regret staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent Classy Place

reviews.text: location is great, and not too pricey. staff not too friendly (have a feeling they are a bit biased towards the guests). queue for check in and check out and concierge is always long. looks more like public information counters. noisy and busy lobby. room is not impressive.
reviews.title: very commercial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It had been 2 years since my wife and I stayed at the Meritus Mandarin and at that time there was a certain amount of refurbishment going on (not that we could tell) so it was good to get back and see what had changed since our last visit.
reviews.title: A Change Is As Good As A Holiday

reviews.text: To start with, the entrance to the hotel had been moved from Orchard Road to Orchard Link which I think is a bit better and the Hotel Lobby had been moved to the 5th Floor as levels 1 - 4 were being renovated into a shopping mall and restaurant precinct. These refurbishments are due to be completed in December 2009.
reviews.title: Far too big but nevertheless good for families.

reviews.text: Hotel in on the Orchard road, near all the malls and foodcourt. If you are tired of walking / shopping you can take a nap in your room to avoid the heat of the day. I did not have breakfast with the room but did breakfast at the restaurant on the 5th floor. More than enough to taste the food of the food court like the famous Dim Sum at Dien Tay Fung. You had to wait at least for 30 min. before you can have a table.
reviews.title: highly recommended place to stay in singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i find this hotel exellent to stay. accessable to restaurants of your choice /along orchard road are all shopping up to 10pm easy to transportation whether train bus or taxi. respected staff. rooms are big.. 2914 where is was booked has a massage chair from head to foot. has the privilege to avail of their club meritus. free breakfast tea and drink cocktail from 5pm free wifi anywhere you can check out the internet for hotel promos on this 5 star hotel very reasonable rates
reviews.title: Needs more staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used as a stopover and chosen because of its convenient position for all the Orchard Rd shopping Malls.
reviews.title: Shoppers dream

reviews.text: The hotel itself is good, with friendly and efficient service, and the rooms are of a good size and well equipped. The bed was extremely comfortable and gave a good nights sleep after a long flight. Our room on the 8th floor of the wing suffered very little noise from Orchard Road or neighbouring rooms.
reviews.title: I keep coming back

reviews.text: The circular tower restaurant was closed for refurbishment and the swimming pool was extremely small, but otherwise I cannot fault the hotel or it's staff.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: In the middle of the shops of Orchard Road. The Gallery attached to the hotel has nice restaurants (Mr. Jones, a deli; and the ramen restaurant are my favorites). It's beside Takashimaya which has a great book store, Kinukuniya (it has much more than Japanese books but lots of those, too).
reviews.title: Best hotel in Orchard

reviews.text: I usually travel with my family but this time I was a solo traveller staying a week at the Mandarin. My check I'm was quick and efficient. I stayed in the main tower on level 24. On arrival the only problem was that I had no towels I rang housekeeping and they were brought to my room promptly. You know what impressed me though was the telephonist who put me thru to housekeeping rang me back to make sure said towels were delivered and was there anything else that could be done! I thought that was a really nice touch. It is a very busy hotel probably because it is in such a central location near all the cool shopping locations. But if you don't want to venture out too far the Mandarin Gallery which is in the complex had world class shopping and eateries. The room service is excellent and very fast. Unfortunately I left it quite late to make enquiries about a late checkout on my day of departure and was told the hotel would not be able to accommodate me. But as I was travelling in the lift a manager (I think), a very nice man,Mr Ryan ? Kwoek (sorry if I misspelt) asked what I was doing that day and I said I was checking out and he asked what time my flight was and I replied not till 10.30 that night and I was unable to get a late checkout, that I was going to leave my bags at reception and do a bit more shopping if I could squeeze any more into my bags! And probably go to a movie or something just to kill time until my airport pickup at around 7 pm. He told me to use his name and come back around 5.30 or 6pm and ask for a hospitality room so I could shower and freshen up before my flight. What a difference that made to me. I felt so much better after that shower knowing I had at least a 7 hour flight back to the Gold Coast. I would highly recommend staying at the Mandarin Orchard Hotel. Oh and by the way try the cafe and bar on level 5 reception it is excellent. Do try their Japanese Hakaido (?) salted caramel pudding and the passion fruit macaron absolutely delicious!!
reviews.title: In between Orchard

reviews.text: Stayed in a room in the original tower. Rooms are tired and noise from renovations continues from early morning until late at night. With so many hotels in Singapore to choose from best to wait until renovations are over before staying at the Meritus Mandarin
reviews.title: don't visit until renovations are complete

reviews.text: I spent 5 nights at the Meritus Mandarin in mid-June. The hotel was undergoing renovations so we had to walk down a long corridor to get to the lifts, but it wasn't too inconvenient. You could hear the construction in the lobby but it was quiet in our hotel room on the 20th floor (although we heard occasional clicking noises in the air-con).
reviews.title: Great location but not 5 star quality

reviews.text: The location was fantastic. Centrally located on Orchard Road between all the shopping malls, and only a 3 minute walk to Somerset MRT station. It was also very close to the Singapore Visitor's Centre where we went for tourist maps and to redeem taxi vouchers as part of the tourism promotion.
reviews.title: Too long to check in and out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room did seem a bit old - the furniture was outdated, and the tv remote control was missing the battery cover. The bed sheets and quilt covers had stains and holes - certainly not 5 star quality.
reviews.title: Excellent location

likes.liked: — Check-in / front desk , Staff Service, Room Service

reviews.text: I wanted to try out the swimming pool but was advised it was closed due to the renovations. The hotel did say they were able to reimburse my taxi travel to the Marina Mandarin hotel if I wanted to use their pool, but I didn't take them up on the offer.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: We arrived early but our rooms were ready for check in, glad we did not have to wait for official check in time.as the hotel is next to one of the biggest shopping centres in Singapore so we were able to get straight to the shops! The room was spacious and clean and with the usual room amenities of a 5 star hotel, nothing spectacular, in fact I felt the room was a bit dark and as the furniture was of dark wood, the room felt dated even though the hotel has been renovated recently. The bathroom sink was partially blocked for the two nights stay, we did not complain as we expected the cleaners to have noticed the sink was blocked when they were cleaning the bathroom !
reviews.title: A comfortable hotel

reviews.text: The Chatterbox restaurant was ok only, but the "famous " chicken rice has lost it shine! it was better before. (you can get better chicken rice outside the hotel restaurant )
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE & LOCATION

reviews.text: The breakfast was not good, as the food served especially the dim sum was quite tasteless. The fresh fruits looked a bit " tired" the French toast was done with raisin bread and was soggy.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: However the staff of the restaurant were pleasant and the reception desk staff were also pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: Calm efficiency

reviews.text: On the whole a convenient hotel right in the centre of Orchard Road shopping paradise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I had my wedding banquet at Mandarin Orchard hotel on 7th September, in the ballroom on 35th floor. What can I say, Mandarin Orchard really made it an unforgettable experience, one that is so bad I will not forget in a long time.
reviews.title: Not befitting of the brand, 5 Star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, I'll give Mandarin Orchard the credit for its top-notch standard in food quality. The suite which they provided for my husband and I was also within our expectation in terms of cleanliness and confit level.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Other than that, service is beyond horrendous. My husband and I signed up for the wedding package one year ago, we were promised the exclusivity of the ballroom on level 35 as it is the only ballroom on the level. Of course, restrooms were on the same level. However, we got a rude shock one week prior to our wedding. Our wedding coordinator who holds the position of Assistant Director, called us and informed us that the restrooms would not be available for our guests as there were renovations going on. My husband and I have no other option but to swallow this piece of bad news and carried on with the wedding preps.
reviews.title: Great Location, terrible housekeeping and front desk

reviews.text: On the wedding day, my distinguished guests who included our family, our superiors and close friends had to take elevator from level 35 to level 5 where the lobby is to use the restroom! We, the ones who are supposed to enjoy the big day, received many complaints from our guests. My husband and I even stayed until 1 a.m after the whole banquet to relate the matter to the Assistant Director.
reviews.title: Good Location and Comfortable Stay
Convenient location
reviews.text: No attempt on the Assistant Director's part to do any service recovery was appalling. When she comes back on the next day, Sunday, to conclude the matter, she said,"To show our sincerity, I came back to the hotel on Sunday when I do not have to." That's the last straw that broke the camel's back. We refused to make full payment and demanded for a proper explanation and conclusion to the whole matter. We waited for a whole month, we only received a letter from the finance department to demand for full payment.

Stayed in the hotel on a stopover. Located right in the middle of Orchard Road - Takashimaya's next door, Centepoint, Paragon, etc. are across the road. Great place for Orchard road shopping and eat. Large rooms and bathrooms with twin vanities, and the website offers good deals for weekend stays.
reviews.title: Location,Location,Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, there seems to some renovation going on in the bottom floors and the swimming pool, and the reception lobby has been moved to the 5th floor and made much smaller. The public spaces are hence very busy and it and makes the check in/check out process very chaotic and time-consuming.
reviews.title: Nice Option

reviews.text: While all this doesn't affect the rooms, it does make the getting in and out experience very poor, and I hope they complete the work soon.
reviews.title: Absolutely spot-on!

reviews.text: Stayed a few nights here on a good deal thru wotif, our splurge!. the place is renovating the reception so check in was on level 5 which was not ideal - i guess it will be better after the rennovations but frustrating at the moment/
reviews.title: Good but there are better deals to be had elsewhere at the moment

reviews.text: The rooms were really nice but for me there is a point when you try to be too clever with your technology and it just becomes annoying. I also couldn't turn off one of the lights which was annoying at night - Apart from that beautiful rooms and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Disappointed

description: Established in 1971, Mandarin Orchard Singapore is a veritable icon in the local hospitality industry, embodying rich Oriental charm. Its prominent location in the heart of the world-renowned shopping beltof Orchard Road makes it the preferred hotel of choice for many visitors. Boasting some 1,051 lavish guest rooms, each a harmonious blend of comfort and contemporary elegance, they are equipped withbroadband Internet access, comprehensive amenities and a panoramic view of the city from the higher floors.A smorgasbord of food and beverage offerings is available throughout the hotel. These include award-winning cuisines from Chatterbox, home of the Mandarin Chicken Rice; Mandarin Court Chinese Restaurant; Triple Three, an international buffet restaurant; Coffee & Crust, a café serving tempting cakes, pastries and coffee from illy; and Bar on 5, a chill-out bar five floors above Orchard Road. The hotel also offers expansive meeting and function facilities, as well as advanced audio-visual equipment and intelligent lighting systems, making it the ideal choice for meetings, incentives, conventions and exhibitions.
